alert.note: Alert for Orange; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:54AM EST until December 19 at 10:45PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Jersey...New York... Ramapo River near Mahwah affecting Bergen, Orange, Passaic and Rockland Counties. .A band of heavy rainfall continues over northeastern NJ with 1.5 - 2.5" of precipitation reported. For the Ramapo River...including Mahwah...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River near Mahwah. * WHEN...From this morning to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, State Route 202 floods downstream. Moderate flooding along Route 202 and Route 17. Water into backyards. Minor flooding along Brakeshoe Place, Brook Street and Catherine Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM EST Monday was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 12/21/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Ramapo River Mahwah 8.0 9.3 Mon 6 am EST 9.4 6.8 MSG &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
